channel.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
channel.description:
Hello, I'm just having a problem with 64-bit Java on Linux(Kubuntu). Whenever I click the client 3 times, like click in the playable area 3 times, the JVM says this:
[code] # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f3f373cfb89, pid=7558, tid=139908218329424 # # JRE version: 6.0_14-b08 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (14.0-b16 mixed mode linux-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [libjvm.so+0x1bdb89] # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # /home/zyle/Desktop/Oraculum Client/hs_err_pid7558.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # Aborted [/code]
Is there some sort of bug fix for this? or will I just have to deal with it until better support comes along?

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I’ll give it a shot in my 64-bit VM and report back what happens when I get down there again.

Will be waiting

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:15, topic:291759"][quote author=parabolika link=topic=385551.msg2893605#msg2893605 date=1249064553]

I have x64 bit and the only problem I get is that when I try to use web applets (whether it be with firefox or ie) It doesn’t load. Yet I can compile and use java apps on my desktop. (I’m on windows and to add on to that its vista :S)

You’d have to be running a 64bit browser as well.
[/quote]
I tried ie x64 and it said “You do not have java installed” ect[/quote]

You need the 64 bit Java plugin for that browser too.

frank_:

private servers are so awesome they can segfault java

The Runescape client itself does it too. Jagex just sucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

That might explain it then, I’d blame it on windows.

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:291759”][quote author=oksuper_ link=topic=385551.msg2893444#msg2893444 date=1249056683]

The 64-bit JVM has been having issues since earlier Java 6. Just use 32-bit, the performance loss isn’t even major.

I’ve been using 64-bit JVM from sun for years, even back into the Java 5 years (on linux), and I have never had a single problem with it, and also find the performance to be substantially better than the 32-bit VM. I’d say try it again.

I used 64-bit JVM and it would crash about every time I ran a AWT app. I reinstalled countless times. Still crashed. 32-bit JVM… never crashed
[/quote]

What operating system and, if linux, what distro?

Also, I haven’t really used the 64-bit plugin yet, as it’s fairly new, but it runs applications perfectly for me.[/quote]

Wasn’t under Linux, was under Windows. I don’t think I’ve even tried 64-bit VM under Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:8, topic:291759”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=385551.msg2893020#msg2893020 date=1249016030]

The 64-bit JVM has been having issues since earlier Java 6. Just use 32-bit, the performance loss isn’t even major.

I’ve been using 64-bit JVM from sun for years, even back into the Java 5 years (on linux), and I have never had a single problem with it, and also find the performance to be substantially better than the 32-bit VM. I’d say try it again.
[/quote]

I used 64-bit JVM and it would crash about every time I ran a AWT app. I reinstalled countless times. Still crashed. 32-bit JVM… never crashed :)[/quote]

What operating system and, if linux, what distro?

Also, I haven’t really used the 64-bit plugin yet, as it’s fairly new, but it runs applications perfectly for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

oksuper_:

The 64-bit JVM has been having issues since earlier Java 6. Just use 32-bit, the performance loss isn’t even major.

I’ve been using 64-bit JVM from sun for years, even back into the Java 5 years (on linux), and I have never had a single problem with it, and also find the performance to be substantially better than the 32-bit VM. I’d say try it again.

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?

item.description:
@parabolika wrote:

I’ve been using Sun’s 64bit build on Gentoo for a few years, and haven’t had major any problems. The only thing I can remember was something with the X bindings a while ago (not even sure if this was 64bit only).

Read full topic

item.title: Is 64-bit still buggy?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hello, I’m just having a problem with 64-bit Java on Linux(Kubuntu). Whenever I click the client 3 times, like click in the playable area 3 times, the JVM says this:

#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f3f373cfb89, pid=7558, tid=139908218329424
#
# JRE version: 6.0_14-b08
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (14.0-b16 mixed mode linux-amd64 )
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0x1bdb89]
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# /home/zyle/Desktop/Oraculum Client/hs_err_pid7558.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
#
Aborted

Is there some sort of bug fix for this? or will I just have to deal with it until better support comes along?

Read full topic
